{{AFC submission|t||ts=20150703033433|u=Justshinan|ns=118}} {{Infobox officeholder |name = Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor |image = Ahmed adeeb tourism minister.jpg |caption = |office = Minister of Tourism, Arts & Culture |term_start = 17 November 2013 |term_end = Incumbent |party = [[Progressive Party of Maldives]] |religion = [[Islam]] |alma_mater = [[Staffordshire University]]
[[Edith Cowan University]] }} [[File:Ahmed adeeb tourism minister.jpg|thumb|Ahmed Adeeb, Minister of Tourism Arts & Culture, Republic of Maldives]] [[File:Adeeb with youths.jpg|thumb|Ahmed Adeeb with some youths who joined Progressive Party of Maldives in their Grand Rally.]] '''Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor''' ({{lang-dv|އަހުމަދު އަދީބު އަބްދުލް ޤަފޫރު}}; born 11th April 1982) is the current Minister of Tourism, Arts & Culture of the [[Government of Maldives]]. He is also the Vice President of the ruling [[Progressive Party of Maldives]]. ==Biography== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in the Capital of Maldives, [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. Adeeb is married to Liusha since 2006 and have a son and a daughter, Izyan and Aysha. ==Education & Early Career== Ahmed Adeeb attended the iconic [[Majeediyaa School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master's in Business Administrator Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008 he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected to the President post of MNCCI in 2011. Adeeb stepped into the national spotlight in 2009 as a young, academic discussing various economic issues relating to the government. Right After [[Abdulla Yameen]] was sworn in as [[President of Maldives]], On November 17th 2012, Ahmed Adeeb was appointed as Minister of Tourism Arts & Culture. [http://www.tourism.gov.mv/news/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ Mr. Ahmed Adeeb appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts & Culture] ==Political Career== Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Ahmed Adeeb is also the Co-chair of the Economic Council. Ahmed Adeeb is a major stakeholder in the Maldives politics. ==Rumors About Becoming Vice President== There has been strong rumors that Ahmed Adeeb will soon be appointed as the new Vice President of Maldives. The Leader of the Parliamentary Group of ruling [[Progressive Party of Maldives]], Ahmed Nihan has stated that Ahmed Adeeb deserves to be Vice President. [http://cnm.mv/english/f/?id=9806 Adeeb deserves to be Vice President - PG Leader Ahmed Nihan] There has also been a no-confidence motion submitted against the current VP to the Parliament by the ruling PPM. [http://cnm.mv/english/f/?id=9876 VP no confidence motion submitted with support of 61 MPs] The current Vice President, [[Dr. Mohamed Jameel Ahmed]] recently Speaking to The New Indian Express, stated that the no confidence motion filed against him was “a constitutional coup in the guise of constitutional reforms” and called on friends of Maldives to “step in” as “they understand what’s happening.” Tourism Minister Ahmed Adeeb, widely believed to be Dr. Jameel’s replacement, had fired back at the interview. [http://www.miadhu.com/article/en/2681 Tourism Minister Ahmed Adeeb fires back at VP Jameel] ==References== {{reflist}} * * * *

Prior to his appointment on 22 July 2015, he served as the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture. ==Life and career== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. Adeeb is married with two children. Ahmed Adeeb attended the iconic [[Majeediyaa School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master's in Business Administrator Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008 he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected as President of the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) in 2011. Adeeb stepped into the national spotlight in 2009 as a young academic discussing various economic issues relating to the government. ==Political career== After the controversial resignation of President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] on February 7 2012, President Waheed appointed Ahmed Adeeb as Tourism Minister.http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 After [[Abdulla Yameen]] was sworn in as [[President of Maldives]], on November 17, 2013, Ahmed Adeeb was appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture with out election.[http://www.tourism.gov.mv/news/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ Mr. Ahmed Adeeb appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts & Culture] Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Ahmed Adeeb was also the Co-chair of the Economic Council. Ahmed Adeeb is a major stakeholder in Maldives politics.[http://www.tourism.gov.mv/news/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ Mr. Ahmed Adeeb appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts & Culture] ==Personal life== Ahmed Adeeb married Fathamath Liusha in the year 2006. She belongs to an affluent family in Male' and has been epitome of support during her husbands struggling days. Together they have two children, a son and a daughter. ==Vice Presidency rumors== There were strong rumors that Ahmed Adeeb would be appointed as the new Vice President of Maldives. The Leader of the Parliamentary Group of ruling [[Progressive Party of Maldives]], Ahmed Nihan, stated that Ahmed Adeeb deserves to be Vice President.[http://cnm.mv/english/f/?id=9806 Adeeb deserves to be Vice President - PG Leader Ahmed Nihan] There was also a no-confidence motion submitted against Vice President to the Parliament by the ruling PPM.[http://cnm.mv/english/f/?id=9876 VP no confidence motion submitted with support of 61 MPs] Vice President [[Mohamed Jameel Ahmed]], speaking to ''The New Indian Express'', stated that the no confidence motion filed against him was “a constitutional coup in the guise of constitutional reforms” and called on friends of Maldives to “step in” as “they understand what’s happening.” Adeeb, widely believed to be Jameel’s replacement, fired back at the interview.[http://www.miadhu.com/article/en/2681 Tourism Minister Ahmed Adeeb fires back at VP Jameel] ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Adeeb, Ahmed}} [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:Living people]]

Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. Ahmed Adeeb attended the iconic [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008 he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected as President of the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) in 2011. Adeeb stepped into the national spotlight in 2009 as a young academic discussing various economic issues relating to the government. On Saturday October 24th it was announced that Adeeb had been arrested by Maldives police in connection with a September 28th 2015 bomb attack which targeted Maldives president [[Abdulla Yameen|Yameen Abdul Gayoon]]. ==Political career== After the controversial resignation of President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] on February 7, 2012, President Waheed appointed Ahmed Adeeb as Tourism Minister.http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 After [[Abdulla Yameen]] was sworn in as [[President of Maldives]], on November 17, 2013, Ahmed Adeeb was appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.[http://www.tourism.gov.mv/news/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ Mr. Ahmed Adeeb appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts & Culture] Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Ahmed Adeeb was also the chair of the Economic Council. Ahmed Adeeb is a major stakeholder in Maldives politics.[http://www.tourism.gov.mv/news/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ Mr. Ahmed Adeeb appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts & Culture] ==Personal life== Ahmed Adeeb married Fathimath Liusha in the year 2006. She belongs to an affluent family in Male' and has been the epitome of support during her husbands struggling days, when he was involving into some dangerous business.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7bGkrnLR8AA Together they have two children, a son and a daughter. ==Vice Presidency== In July 2015, His Excellency President [[Abdulla Yameen]] appointed Ahmed Adeeb as the Vice President of Maldives. The oath taking ceremony was held at the President’s Office where the oath was administered by Chief Justice Abdulla Saeed. The People’s Majlis approved his nomination with 70 votes in favor. Ahmed Adeeb is currently the youngest Vice President in the world to assume office. ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Adeeb, Ahmed}} [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:Living people]]

Prior to his appointment on 22 July 2015, he served as the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture. ==Early career and family life== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. Ahmed Adeeb attended the [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008 he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. Prior to his appointment on 22 July 2015, he served as the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture. ==Early career and family life== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. Ahmed Adeeb attended the [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008 he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected as President of the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) in 2011. Adeeb stepped into the national spotlight in 2009 as a young academic discussing various economic issues relating to the government. He became the fifth Vice President of Maldives on 22 July 2015. On 24 October 2015 it was announced that Adeeb had been arrested by Maldives police in connection with a 28 September 2015 bomb attack which targeted President [[Abdulla Yameen]]. On 5 November, Adeeb was removed from office asVice President by a [[no confidence vote]] from the [[People's Majlis]].{{cite web|title= Maldives crisis: Vice-President Ahmed Adeeb removed from power|url=http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-34736787|accessdate=5 November 2015}} He is currently held in [[Dhoonidhoo]] prison awaiting trial. ==Political career== After the controversial resignation of President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] on February 7, 2012, President Waheed appointed Ahmed Adeeb as Tourism Minister.http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 After [[Abdulla Yameen]] was sworn in as [[President of Maldives]], on November 17, 2013, Ahmed Adeeb was appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.[http://www.tourism.gov.mv/news/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ Mr. Ahmed Adeeb appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts & Culture] Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Ahmed Adeeb was also the chair of the Economic Council. She belongs to an affluent family in Male'.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7bGkrnLR8AA Together they have two children, a son and a daughter. ==Vice Presidency== In July 2015, President [[Abdulla Yameen]] appointed Ahmed Adeeb as the Vice President of Maldives. The oath taking ceremony was held at the President’s Office where the oath was administered by Chief Justice Abdulla Saeed. The People’s Majlis approved his nomination with 70 votes in favor. Ahmed Adeeb was the youngest vice president in the world at the time. ==Arrest== On 24 October 2015, Ahmed Adeeb was arrested for planting an IED on the Presidential Launch. Ahmed Adeeb and his Uncle travelled to Aarah on the Presidential Launch on Friday the 25th of September three days before the President was to return to Male from his visit abroad. The time they arrived in Aarah was about Maghrib Prayer time. While both Uncle and Adeeb stayed on the launch they sent the crew ashore to perform the evening Maghrib Prayers. According to the crew during investigations, this was the only time that the Presidential Launch was left without any crew. (It was the critical moment that Adeeb and his Uncle planted the IED that was made for him by an MNDF officer) Two explosive devices were planted, both to be explode remotely using a GSM connection. Having been convicted of this felony to assassinate the President of Maldives, he has been sentenced to Thirty Years in Prison. The President was traveling on the presidential speedboat, when a blast occurred on the boat on 28 September 2015. [[Abdulla Yameen]] |birth_name=Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1982|4|11|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Malé]], [[Maldives]] |spouse = {{marriage|Aminath Liusha|2006|2018|end=div}}{{marriage|Maryam Nashwa|2015}} |children = 2 |party = [[Maldives Third Way Democrats]] |otherparty = [[Progressive Party of Maldives]] |alma_mater = [[Staffordshire University]]
[[Edith Cowan University]] |website = {{URL|adeeb.mv}} }} [[File:Adeeb with youths.jpg|thumb|Ahmed Adeeb with some youth leaders who joined Progressive Party of Maldives in their Grand Rally.]] '''Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor''' ({{lang-dv|އަހުމަދު އަދީބު އަބްދުލް ޤަފޫރު}}; born 11 April 1982) is a Maldivian politician who briefly served as [[Vice President of Maldives]] in 2015. Prior to his appointment on 22 July 2015, he served as the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture. ==Early career and family life== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. Ahmed Adeeb attended the [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008 he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected as President of the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) in 2011. Adeeb stepped into the national spotlight in 2009 as a young academic discussing various economic issues relating to the government. He became the fifth Vice President of Maldives on 22 July 2015. On 24 October 2015 it was announced that Adeeb had been arrested by Maldives police in connection with a 28 September 2015 bomb attack which targeted President [[Abdulla Yameen]]. On 5 November, Adeeb was removed from office as Vice President by a [[no confidence vote]] from the [[People's Majlis]].{{cite web|title= Maldives crisis: Vice-President Ahmed Adeeb removed from power|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-34736787|accessdate=5 November 2015}} [[File:Dhoonidhoo prison island - Male,maldives- 2013-05-06 22-55 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Dhoonidhoo prison island]] He is currently held in [[Dhoonidhoo]] prison awaiting trial. ==Political career== After the controversial resignation of President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] on 7 February 2012, President Waheed appointed Ahmed Adeeb as Tourism Minister.{{Cite web |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |title=Archived copy |access-date=10 July 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150710221430/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |archive-date=10 July 2015 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} After [[Abdulla Yameen]] was sworn in as [[President of Maldives]], on 17 November 2013, Ahmed Adeeb was appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{cite web | url=http://www.tourism.gov.mv/21/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ | title=Mr. Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Gafoor was appointed as Minister of Tourism by H.E. President Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom | publisher=Ministry of Tourism, Republic of Maldives | date=17 November 2013 | accessdate=8 January 2019}} Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Ahmed Adeeb was also the chair of the Economic Council. Ahmed Adeeb is a major stakeholder in Maldives politics. ==Personal life == Ahmed Adeeb married Fathimath Liusha in 2006 and belongs to an affluent family in Male’. His wife has been pillar of strength to him even before his political career. Together, they have two children, a son and a daughter. ==Vice Presidency== In July 2015, President [[Abdulla Yameen]] appointed Ahmed Adeeb as the Vice President of Maldives. The oath taking ceremony was held at the President’s Office where the oath was administered by Chief Justice Abdulla Saeed. The People’s Majlis approved his nomination with 70 votes in favor. Ahmed Adeeb was the youngest vice president in the world at the time. ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Adeeb, Ahmed}} [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Alumni of Staffordshire University]] [[Category:Edith Cowan University alumni]] [[Category:Progressive Party of Maldives politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian prisoners and detainees]]

He represented club and country in youth age groups before his academia took him away from a possible future as a professional. His other interests include water sports and adventure sports. He loves music and often plays the guitar in his spare time. His love for music also led to his sponsorship and event sourcing of the biggest major concert gigs in the Maldives, which included international artist Akon, as well as Bollywood stars and bands.{{Cite web|url=https://en.sun.mv/26978|title=Adeeb: Priyanka and Akon will join tomorrow|last=Jan 07|first=1|last2=2015 11:27|website=SunOnline International|language=en|access-date=2019-12-04}} Adeeb’s father served in the military and his mother worked as an executive at the Maldives Customs Service. At the age of 33, Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor entered the history books as the youngest vice president in the world at the time.‬ ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Adeeb, Ahmed}} [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Alumni of Staffordshire University]] [[Category:Edith Cowan University alumni]] [[Category:Progressive Party of Maldives politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian prisoners and detainees]]

He represented club and country in youth age groups before his academia took him away from a possible future as a professional. His other interests include water sports and adventure sports. He loves music and often plays the guitar in his spare time. [[Edith Cowan University]] | website = {{URL|https://presidency.gov.mv/PO/FormerVP/2}} }} [[File:Adeeb with youths.jpg|thumb|Ahmed Adeeb with some youth leaders who joined Progressive Party of Maldives in their Grand Rally.]] '''Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor''' ({{lang-dv|އަހުމަދު އަދީބު އަބްދުލް ޤަފޫރު}}; born 11 April 1982) is a Maldivian politician who briefly served as [[Vice President of Maldives]] in 2015. Prior to his appointment on 22 July 2015, he served as the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture. ==Early career and family life== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. Ahmed Adeeb attended the [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008 he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected as President of the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) in 2011. Adeeb stepped into the national spotlight in 2009 as a young academic discussing various economic issues relating to the government. He became the fifth Vice President of Maldives on 22 July 2015. On 24 October 2015 it was announced that Adeeb had been arrested by Maldives police in connection with a 28 September 2015 bomb attack which targeted President [[Abdulla Yameen]]. On 5 November, Adeeb was removed from office as Vice President by a [[no confidence vote]] from the [[People's Majlis]].{{cite web|title= Maldives crisis: Vice-President Ahmed Adeeb removed from power|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-34736787|accessdate=5 November 2015}} [[File:Dhoonidhoo prison island - Male,maldives- 2013-05-06 22-55 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Dhoonidhoo prison island]] Adeeb was detained by Indian authorities on 1 August 2019 after he arrived illegally by tugboat in the city of [[Thoothukudi]], Tamil Nadu. Indian officials stated that Adeeb was detained because he did not have valid travel documents and did not arrive at a legal port of entry. Adeeb was transferred to the Maldives escorted by the [[Indian Coast Guard]], where he was arrested by Maldivian police.{{cite web |title=Maldives police arrest ex-vice president Adeeb after India denies entry - Times of India |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/south-asia/maldives-police-arrest-ex-vice-president-adeeb-after-india-denies-entry/articleshow/70514649.cms |website=The Times of India |accessdate=3 August 2019}} ==Political career== After the controversial resignation of President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] on 7 February 2012, President Waheed appointed Ahmed Adeeb as Tourism Minister.{{Cite web |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |title=Archived copy |access-date=10 July 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150710221430/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |archive-date=10 July 2015 |url-status=dead |df=dmy-all }} After [[Abdulla Yameen]] was sworn in as [[President of Maldives]], on 17 November 2013, Ahmed Adeeb was appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{cite web | url=http://www.tourism.gov.mv/21/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ | title=Mr. Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Gafoor was appointed as Minister of Tourism by H.E. President Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom | publisher=Ministry of Tourism, Republic of Maldives | date=17 November 2013 | accessdate=8 January 2019}} Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Ahmed Adeeb was also the chair of the Economic Council. Ahmed Adeeb is a major stakeholder in Maldives politics. ==Personal life == Ahmed Adeeb is an avid footballer, having been earmarked at a tender age for his skills. He represented club and country in youth age groups before his academia took him away from a possible future as a professional. His other interests include water sports and adventure sports. He loves music and often plays the guitar in his spare time. His love for music also led to his sponsorship and event sourcing of the biggest major concert gigs in the Maldives, which included international artist Akon, as well as Bollywood stars and bands.{{Cite web|url=https://en.sun.mv/26978|title=Adeeb: Priyanka and Akon will join tomorrow|last=Jan 07|first=1|last2=2015 11:27|website=SunOnline International|language=en|access-date=2019-12-04}} Adeeb’s father served in the military and his mother worked as an executive at the Maldives Customs Service. Adeeb is currently married to Mariyam Nashwa{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/maryam_nashwa|title=Nash (@maryam_nashwa) {{!}} Twitter|website=twitter.com|language=en|access-date=2019-12-04}} and is the dad of two children, daughter Eevie and son Izyan from his previous marriage. ==Vice Presidency== Following the historic decision by the Maldives’ People’s Majlis to bring first amendment to the 2007 Constitution by capping the eligibility age for presidency between 30 and 65 years{{Cite web|url=https://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/majlis-amends-constitution-sets-new-age-limits-for-presidency-100091|title=Majlis amends constitution, sets new age-limits for presidency – Minivan News – Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=2019-12-04}} and thereby paving the way for a “youth” Vice President and the impeachment of Dr. Mohamed Jameel Ahmed from his Vice Presidency portfolio, Adeeb was appointed as Vice President on 23 July 2015. Prior to his appointment on 22 July 2015, he served as the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture. ==Early career and family life== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. Ahmed Adeeb attended the [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008 he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. Adeeb stepped into the national spotlight in 2009 as a young academic discussing various economic issues relating to the government. He became the fifth Vice President of Maldives on 22 July 2015. Indian officials stated that Adeeb was detained because he did not have valid travel documents and did not arrive at a legal port of entry. President Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom | publisher=Ministry of Tourism, Republic of Maldives | date=17 November 2013 | accessdate=8 January 2019}} Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Ahmed Adeeb was also the chair of the Economic Council. Ahmed Adeeb is a major stakeholder in Maldives politics. ==Personal life == Ahmed Adeeb is an avid footballer, having been earmarked at a tender age for his skills. He represented club and country in youth age groups before his academia took him away from a possible future as a professional. His other interests include water sports and adventure sports. He loves music and often plays the guitar in his spare time. His love for music also led to his sponsorship and event sourcing of the biggest major concert gigs in the Maldives, which included international artist Akon, as well as Bollywood stars and bands.{{Cite web|url=https://en.sun.mv/26978|title=Adeeb: Priyanka and Akon will join tomorrow|last=Jan 07|first=1|last2=2015 11:27|website=SunOnline International|language=en|access-date=2019-12-04}} Adeeb’s father served in the military and his mother worked as an executive at the Maldives Customs Service. He represented club and country in youth age groups before his academia took him away from a possible future as a professional. His other interests include water sports and adventure sports. Prior to his appointment on 22 July 2015, he served as the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{Cite web|title=Ahmed Adheeb Abdul Ghafoor - The President's Office|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/PO/FormerVP/2|access-date=8 October 2020|website=presidency.gov.mv}} ==Early life and education== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. He attended the [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. == Career == Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008, he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected as President of the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) in 2011. President Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom | publisher=Ministry of Tourism, Republic of Maldives | date=17 November 2013 | accessdate=8 January 2019}} Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Ahmed Adeeb was also the chair of the Economic Council. ==Personal life == Ahmed Adeeb is an avid footballer, having been earmarked at a tender age for his skills. He represented club and country in youth age groups before his academia took him away from a possible future as a professional. His other interests include water sports and adventure sports. He loves music and often plays the guitar in his spare time. His love for music also led to his sponsorship and event sourcing of the biggest major concert gigs in the Maldives, which included international artist Akon, as well as Bollywood stars and bands.{{Cite web|url=https://en.sun.mv/26978|title=Adeeb: Priyanka and Akon will join tomorrow|last1=Jan 07|first1=1|last2=2015 11:27|website=SunOnline International|language=en|access-date=4 December 2019}} Adeeb's father served in the military and his mother worked as an executive at the Maldives Customs Service. [[Edith Cowan University]] | website = {{URL|https://presidency.gov.mv/PO/FormerVP/2}} }} [[File:Adeeb with youths.jpg|thumb|Ahmed Adeeb (centre) with some youth leaders who joined Progressive Party of Maldives in their Grand Rally.]] '''Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor''' ({{lang-dv|އަޙްމަދު އަދީބު ޢަބްދުލްޣަފޫރު}}; born 11 April 1982) is a Maldivian politician who briefly served as [[Vice President of Maldives]] in 2015. Prior to his appointment on 22 July 2015, he served as the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{Cite web|title=Ahmed Adheeb Abdul Ghafoor - The President's Office|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/PO/FormerVP/2|access-date=8 October 2020|website=presidency.gov.mv}} ==Early life and education== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. He attended the [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. == Career == Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008, he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected as President of the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) in 2011. Adeeb stepped into the national spotlight in 2009 as a young academic discussing various economic issues relating to the government. On 22 July 2015, he became the fifth Vice President of Maldives. On 24 October 2015, it was announced that Adeeb had been arrested by Maldives police in connection with a 28 September 2015 bomb attack which targeted President [[Abdulla Yameen]]. On 5 November, Adeeb was removed from office as vice president by a [[no confidence vote]] from the [[People's Majlis]].{{cite web|title= Maldives crisis: Vice-President Ahmed Adeeb removed from power|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-34736787|accessdate=5 November 2015}} [[File:Dhoonidhoo prison island - Male,maldives- 2013-05-06 22-55 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Dhoonidhoo prison island]] ==Political career== After the controversial resignation of President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] on 7 February 2012, President Waheed appointed Ahmed Adeeb as Tourism Minister.{{Cite web |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |title=Archived copy |access-date=10 July 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150710221430/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |archive-date=10 July 2015 |url-status=dead }} After [[Abdulla Yameen]] was sworn in as [[President of Maldives]], on 17 November 2013, Ahmed Adeeb was appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{cite web | url=http://www.tourism.gov.mv/21/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ | title=Mr. Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Gafoor was appointed as Minister of Tourism by H.E. President Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom | publisher=Ministry of Tourism, Republic of Maldives | date=17 November 2013 | accessdate=8 January 2019}} Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Ahmed Adeeb was also the chair of the Economic Council. ==Personal life == Ahmed Adeeb is an avid footballer, having been earmarked at a tender age for his skills. He represented club and country in youth age groups before his academia took him away from a possible future as a professional. His other interests include water sports and adventure sports. He loves music and often plays the guitar in his spare time. His love for music also led to his sponsorship and event sourcing of the biggest major concert gigs in the Maldives, which included international artist Akon, as well as Bollywood stars and bands.{{Cite web|url=https://en.sun.mv/26978|title=Adeeb: Priyanka and Akon will join tomorrow|last1=Jan 07|first1=1|last2=2015 11:27|website=SunOnline International|language=en|access-date=4 December 2019}} Adeeb's father served in the military and his mother worked as an executive at the Maldives Customs Service. Adeeb is currently married to Mariyam Nashwa{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/maryam_nashwa|title=Nash (@maryam_nashwa) {{!}} Twitter|website=twitter.com|language=en|access-date=4 December 2019}} and is the dad of two children, daughter Eevie and son Izyan from his previous marriage. ==Vice Presidency== Following the historic decision by the Maldives’ People's Majlis to bring first amendment to the 2007 Constitution by capping the eligibility age for presidency between 30 and 65 years{{Cite web|url=https://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/majlis-amends-constitution-sets-new-age-limits-for-presidency-100091|title=Majlis amends constitution, sets new age-limits for presidency – Minivan News – Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=4 December 2019}} and thereby paving the way for a “youth” Vice President and the impeachment of Dr. Mohamed Jameel Ahmed from his vice presidency portfolio, Adeeb was appointed as vice president on 23 July 2015. Indian officials stated that Adeeb was detained because he did not have valid travel documents and did not arrive at a legal port of entry. Adeeb was transferred to the Maldives escorted by the [[Indian Coast Guard]], where he was arrested by Maldivian police.{{cite web|title=Maldives police arrest ex-vice president Adeeb after India denies entry - Times of India|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/south-asia/maldives-police-arrest-ex-vice-president-adeeb-after-india-denies-entry/articleshow/70514649.cms|accessdate=3 August 2019|website=The Times of India}} On 6 October 2020, Ahmed Adeeb was sentenced to 20 years in prison, after he pleaded guilty to [[money laundering]] and [[embezzlement]] under orders from the former president [[Abdulla Yameen]].{{cite web|title=Maldives ex-vice president gets 20 years for graft|url=https://www.france24.com/en/20201006-maldives-ex-vice-president-gets-20-years-for-graft|accessdate=6 October 2020|website=France 24}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Vice Presidents of the Maldives}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Adeeb, Ahmed}} [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Alumni of Staffordshire University]] [[Category:Edith Cowan University alumni]] [[Category:Progressive Party of Maldives politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian prisoners and detainees]]

{{short description|Maldivian politician (born 1982)}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2020}} {{Infobox officeholder | name = Ahmed Adeeb | native_name = {{nobold|އަހުމަދު އަދީބު}} |image = | office = 5th [[Vice President of the Maldives]] | term_start = 22 July 2015 | term_end = 5 November 2015 | predecessor = [[Mohamed Jameel Ahmed]] | successor = [[Abdulla Jihad]] | president = [[Abdulla Yameen]] | office2 = [[Progressive Party of Maldives|Vice President of Progressive Party of Maldives]] | term_start2 = 18 January 2013 | term_end2 = 27 October 2015 | office1 = [[Ministry of Tourism (Maldives)|Minister of Tourism, Arts & Culture]] | term_start1 = 12 February 2012 | term_end1 = 22 July 2015 | predecessor1 = [[Dr. Mariyam Zulfa]] | successor1 = [[Moosa Zameer]] | president1 = [[Mohamed Waheed Hassan]]
[[Abdulla Yameen]] | birth_name = Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1982|4|11|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Malé, Maldives]] | spouse = {{marriage|Aminath Liusha|2006|2018|end=div}}{{marriage|Maryam Nashwa|2015}} | children = 2 | party = [[Maldives Third Way Democrats]] | otherparty = [[Progressive Party of Maldives]] | alma_mater = [[Staffordshire University]]
[[Edith Cowan University]] | website = {{URL|https://presidency.gov.mv/PO/FormerVP/2}} }} [[File:Adeeb with youths.jpg|thumb|Ahmed Adeeb (centre) with some youth leaders who joined Progressive Party of Maldives in their Grand Rally.]] '''Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor''' ({{lang-dv|އަޙްމަދު އަދީބު ޢަބްދުލްޣަފޫރު}}; born 11 April 1982) is a Maldivian politician who briefly served as [[Vice President of Maldives]] in 2015. Prior to his appointment on 22 July 2015, he served as the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{Cite web|title=Ahmed Adheeb Abdul Ghafoor - The President's Office|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/PO/FormerVP/2|access-date=8 October 2020|website=presidency.gov.mv}} ==Early life and education== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. He attended the [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. == Career == Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008, he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected as President of the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) in 2011. Adeeb stepped into the national spotlight in 2009 as a young academic discussing various economic issues relating to the government. On 22 July 2015, he became the fifth Vice President of Maldives. On 24 October 2015, it was announced that Adeeb had been arrested by Maldives police in connection with a 28 September 2015 bomb attack which targeted President [[Abdulla Yameen]]. On 5 November, Adeeb was removed from office as vice president by a [[no confidence vote]] from the [[People's Majlis]].{{cite web|title= Maldives crisis: Vice-President Ahmed Adeeb removed from power|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-34736787|accessdate=5 November 2015}} [[File:Dhoonidhoo prison island - Male,maldives- 2013-05-06 22-55 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Dhoonidhoo prison island]] ==Political career== After the controversial resignation of President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] on 7 February 2012, President Waheed appointed Ahmed Adeeb as Tourism Minister.{{Cite web |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |title=Archived copy |access-date=10 July 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150710221430/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |archive-date=10 July 2015 |url-status=dead }} After [[Abdulla Yameen]] was sworn in as [[President of Maldives]], on 17 November 2013, Ahmed Adeeb was appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{cite web | url=http://www.tourism.gov.mv/21/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ | title=Mr. Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Gafoor was appointed as Minister of Tourism by H.E. President Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom | publisher=Ministry of Tourism, Republic of Maldives | date=17 November 2013 | accessdate=8 January 2019}} Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Ahmed Adeeb was also the chair of the Economic Council. ==Personal life == Ahmed Adeeb is an avid footballer, having been earmarked at a tender age for his skills. He represented club and country in youth age groups before his academia took him away from a possible future as a professional. His other interests include water sports and adventure sports. He loves music and often plays the guitar in his spare time. His love for music also led to his sponsorship and event sourcing of the biggest major concert gigs in the Maldives, which included international artist Akon, as well as Bollywood stars and bands.{{Cite web|url=https://en.sun.mv/26978|title=Adeeb: Priyanka and Akon will join tomorrow|last1=Jan 07|first1=1|last2=2015 11:27|website=SunOnline International|language=en|access-date=4 December 2019}} Adeeb's father served in the military and his mother worked as an executive at the Maldives Customs Service. Adeeb is currently married to Mariyam Nashwa{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/maryam_nashwa|title=Nash (@maryam_nashwa) {{!}} Twitter|website=twitter.com|language=en|access-date=4 December 2019}} and is the dad of two children, daughter Eevie and son Izyan from his previous marriage. ==Vice Presidency== Following the historic decision by the Maldives’ People's Majlis to bring first amendment to the 2007 Constitution by capping the eligibility age for presidency between 30 and 65 years{{Cite web|url=https://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/majlis-amends-constitution-sets-new-age-limits-for-presidency-100091|title=Majlis amends constitution, sets new age-limits for presidency – Minivan News – Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=4 December 2019}} and thereby paving the way for a “youth” Vice President and the impeachment of Dr. Mohamed Jameel Ahmed from his vice presidency portfolio, Adeeb was appointed as vice president on 23 July 2015. His appointment was endorsed by the People's Majlis by a record majority of 78 out of 85 votes in favour.{{Cite web|url=https://archive.mv/en/articles/wJEEp|title=Majlis approves Adeeb as vice president|website=archivemv|language=en|access-date=4 December 2019}} At the age of 33, Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor entered the history books as the youngest vice president in the world at the time.{{Citation needed|date=October 2020}} == Controversies == Adeeb was detained by Indian authorities on 1 August 2019 after he arrived illegally by tugboat in the city of [[Thoothukudi]], Tamil Nadu. Indian officials stated that Adeeb was detained because he did not have valid travel documents and did not arrive at a legal port of entry. Adeeb was transferred to the Maldives escorted by the [[Indian Coast Guard]], where he was arrested by Maldivian police.{{cite web|title=Maldives police arrest ex-vice president Adeeb after India denies entry - Times of India|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/south-asia/maldives-police-arrest-ex-vice-president-adeeb-after-india-denies-entry/articleshow/70514649.cms|accessdate=3 August 2019|website=The Times of India}} On 6 October 2020, Ahmed Adeeb was sentenced to 20 years in prison, after he pleaded guilty to [[money laundering]] and [[embezzlement]] under orders from the former president [[Abdulla Yameen]].{{cite web|title=Maldives ex-vice president gets 20 years for graft|url=https://www.france24.com/en/20201006-maldives-ex-vice-president-gets-20-years-for-graft|accessdate=6 October 2020|website=France 24}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Vice Presidents of the Maldives}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Adeeb, Ahmed}} [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Vice Presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Alumni of Staffordshire University]] [[Category:Edith Cowan University alumni]] [[Category:Progressive Party of Maldives politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian prisoners and detainees]]

Prior to his appointment on 22 July 2015, he served as the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{Cite web|title=Ahmed Adheeb Abdul Ghafoor - The President's Office|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/PO/FormerVP/2|access-date=8 October 2020|website=presidency.gov.mv}} ==Early life and education== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. He attended the [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. == Career == Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008, he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected as President of the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) in 2011. Adeeb stepped into the national spotlight in 2009 as a young academic discussing various economic issues relating to the government. On 22 July 2015, he became the fifth Vice President of Maldives. On 24 October 2015, it was announced that Adeeb had been arrested by Maldives police in connection with a 28 September 2015 bomb attack which targeted President [[Abdulla Yameen]]. On 5 November, Adeeb was removed from office as vice president by a [[no confidence vote]] from the [[People's Majlis]].{{cite web|title= Maldives crisis: Vice-President Ahmed Adeeb removed from power|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-34736787|accessdate=5 November 2015}} [[File:Dhoonidhoo prison island - Male,maldives- 2013-05-06 22-55 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Dhoonidhoo prison island]] ==Political career== After the controversial resignation of President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] on 7 February 2012, President Waheed appointed Ahmed Adeeb as Tourism Minister.{{Cite web |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |title=Archived copy |access-date=10 July 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150710221430/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |archive-date=10 July 2015 |url-status=dead }} After [[Abdulla Yameen]] was sworn in as [[President of Maldives]], on 17 November 2013, Ahmed Adeeb was appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{cite web | url=http://www.tourism.gov.mv/21/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ | title=Mr. Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Gafoor was appointed as Minister of Tourism by H.E. President Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom | publisher=Ministry of Tourism, Republic of Maldives | date=17 November 2013 | accessdate=8 January 2019}} Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Ahmed Adeeb was also the chair of the Economic Council. ==Personal life == Ahmed Adeeb is an avid footballer, having been earmarked at a tender age for his skills. He represented club and country in youth age groups before his academia took him away from a possible future as a professional. His other interests include water sports and adventure sports. He loves music and often plays the guitar in his spare time. His love for music also led to his sponsorship and event sourcing of the biggest major concert gigs in the Maldives, which included international artist Akon, as well as Bollywood stars and bands.{{Cite web|url=https://en.sun.mv/26978|title=Adeeb: Priyanka and Akon will join tomorrow|last1=Jan 07|first1=1|last2=2015 11:27|website=SunOnline International|language=en|access-date=4 December 2019}} Adeeb's father served in the military and his mother worked as an executive at the Maldives Customs Service. Adeeb is currently married to Mariyam Nashwa{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/maryam_nashwa|title=Nash (@maryam_nashwa) {{!}} Twitter|website=twitter.com|language=en|access-date=4 December 2019}} and is the dad of two children, daughter Eevie and son Izyan from his previous marriage. ==Vice Presidency== Following the historic decision by the Maldives’ People's Majlis to bring first amendment to the 2007 Constitution by capping the eligibility age for presidency between 30 and 65 years{{Cite web|url=https://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/majlis-amends-constitution-sets-new-age-limits-for-presidency-100091|title=Majlis amends constitution, sets new age-limits for presidency – Minivan News – Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=4 December 2019}} and thereby paving the way for a “youth” Vice President and the impeachment of Dr. Mohamed Jameel Ahmed from his vice presidency portfolio, Adeeb was appointed as vice president on 23 July 2015. His appointment was endorsed by the People's Majlis by a record majority of 78 out of 85 votes in favour.{{Cite web|url=https://archive.mv/en/articles/wJEEp|title=Majlis approves Adeeb as vice president|website=archivemv|language=en|access-date=4 December 2019}} At the age of 33, Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor entered the history books as the youngest vice president in the world at the time.{{Citation needed|date=October 2020}} == Controversies == Adeeb was detained by Indian authorities on 1 August 2019 after he arrived illegally by tugboat in the city of [[Thoothukudi]], Tamil Nadu. Indian officials stated that Adeeb was detained because he did not have valid travel documents and did not arrive at a legal port of entry. Adeeb was transferred to the Maldives escorted by the [[Indian Coast Guard]], where he was arrested by Maldivian police.{{cite web|title=Maldives police arrest ex-vice president Adeeb after India denies entry - Times of India|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/south-asia/maldives-police-arrest-ex-vice-president-adeeb-after-india-denies-entry/articleshow/70514649.cms|accessdate=3 August 2019|website=The Times of India}} On 6 October 2020, Ahmed Adeeb was sentenced to 20 years in prison, after he pleaded guilty to [[money laundering]] and [[embezzlement]] under orders from the former president [[Abdulla Yameen]].{{cite web|title=Maldives ex-vice president gets 20 years for graft|url=https://www.france24.com/en/20201006-maldives-ex-vice-president-gets-20-years-for-graft|accessdate=6 October 2020|website=France 24}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Vice Presidents of the Maldives}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Adeeb, Ahmed}} [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Alumni of Staffordshire University]] [[Category:Edith Cowan University alumni]] [[Category:Progressive Party of Maldives politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian prisoners and detainees]]

[[Edith Cowan University]] | website = {{URL|https://presidency.gov.mv/PO/FormerVP/2}} }} [[File:Adeeb with youths.jpg|thumb|Ahmed Adeeb (centre) with some youth leaders who joined Progressive Party of Maldives in their Grand Rally.]] '''Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor''' ({{lang-dv|އަޙްމަދު އަދީބު ޢަބްދުލްޣަފޫރު}}; born 11 April 1982) is a Maldivian politician who briefly served as [[Vice President of Maldives]] in 2015. Prior to his appointment on 22 July 2015, he served as the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{Cite web|title=Ahmed Adheeb Abdul Ghafoor - The President's Office|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/PO/FormerVP/2|access-date=8 October 2020|website=presidency.gov.mv}} ==Early life and education== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. He attended the [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. == Career == Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008, he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected as President of the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) in 2011. On 22 July 2015, he became the fifth Vice President of Maldives. On 24 October 2015, it was announced that Adeeb had been arrested by Maldives police in connection with a 28 September 2015 bomb attack which targeted President [[Abdulla Yameen]]. On 5 November, Adeeb was removed from office as vice president by a [[no confidence vote]] from the [[People's Majlis]].{{cite web|title= Maldives crisis: Vice-President Ahmed Adeeb removed from power|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-34736787|accessdate=5 November 2015}} [[File:Dhoonidhoo prison island - Male,maldives- 2013-05-06 22-55 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Dhoonidhoo prison island]] ==Political career== After the controversial resignation of President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] on 7 February 2012, President Waheed appointed Ahmed Adeeb as Tourism Minister.{{Cite web |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |title=Archived copy |access-date=10 July 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150710221430/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |archive-date=10 July 2015 |url-status=dead }} After [[Abdulla Yameen]] was sworn in as [[President of Maldives]], on 17 November 2013, Ahmed Adeeb was appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{cite web | url=http://www.tourism.gov.mv/21/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ | title=Mr. Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Gafoor was appointed as Minister of Tourism by H.E. President Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom | publisher=Ministry of Tourism, Republic of Maldives | date=17 November 2013 | accessdate=8 January 2019}} Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Ahmed Adeeb was also the chair of the Economic Council. Following the historic decision by the Maldives’ People's Majlis to bring first amendment to the 2007 Constitution by capping the eligibility age for presidency between 30 and 65 years{{Cite web|url=https://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/majlis-amends-constitution-sets-new-age-limits-for-presidency-100091|title=Majlis amends constitution, sets new age-limits for presidency – Minivan News – Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=4 December 2019}} and thereby paving the way for a “youth” Vice President and the impeachment of Dr. Mohamed Jameel Ahmed from his vice presidency portfolio, Adeeb was appointed as vice president on 23 July 2015. His appointment was endorsed by the People's Majlis by a record majority of 78 out of 85 votes in favour.{{Cite web|url=https://archive.mv/en/articles/wJEEp|title=Majlis approves Adeeb as vice president|website=archivemv|language=en|access-date=4 December 2019}} == Controversies == Adeeb was detained by Indian authorities on 1 August 2019 after he arrived illegally by tugboat in the city of [[Thoothukudi]], Tamil Nadu. Indian officials stated that Adeeb was detained because he did not have valid travel documents and did not arrive at a legal port of entry. Adeeb was transferred to the Maldives escorted by the [[Indian Coast Guard]], where he was arrested by Maldivian police.{{cite web|title=Maldives police arrest ex-vice president Adeeb after India denies entry - Times of India|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/south-asia/maldives-police-arrest-ex-vice-president-adeeb-after-india-denies-entry/articleshow/70514649.cms|accessdate=3 August 2019|website=The Times of India}} On 6 October 2020, Ahmed Adeeb was sentenced to 20 years in prison, after he pleaded guilty to [[money laundering]] and [[embezzlement]] under orders from the former president [[Abdulla Yameen]].{{cite web|title=Maldives ex-vice president gets 20 years for graft|url=https://www.france24.com/en/20201006-maldives-ex-vice-president-gets-20-years-for-graft|accessdate=6 October 2020|website=France 24}} ==Personal life == {{Primary sources|date=October 2021}} Ahmed Adeeb is an avid footballer. He represented club and country in youth age groups. His love for music led to his sponsorship and event sourcing of the biggest major concert gigs in the Maldives, which included international artist Akon, as well as Bollywood stars and bands.{{Cite web|last1=Jan 07|first1=1|last2=2015 11:27|title=Adeeb: Priyanka and Akon will join tomorrow|url=https://en.sun.mv/26978|access-date=4 December 2019|website=SunOnline International|language=en}} Adeeb's father served in the military and his mother worked as an executive at the Maldives Customs Service. Adeeb is married to Mariyam Nashwa and is the dad of two children, daughter Eevie and son Izyan from his previous marriage. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Vice Presidents of the Maldives}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Adeeb, Ahmed}} [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Alumni of Staffordshire University]] [[Category:Edith Cowan University alumni]] [[Category:Progressive Party of Maldives politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian prisoners and detainees]]

[[Edith Cowan University]] | website = {{URL|https://presidency.gov.mv/PO/FormerVP/2}} }} '''Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor''' ({{lang-dv|އަޙްމަދު އަދީބު ޢަބްދުލްޣަފޫރު}}; born 11 April 1982) is a Maldivian politician who briefly served as [[Vice President of Maldives]] in 2015. Prior to his appointment on 22 July 2015, he served as the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{Cite web|title=Ahmed Adheeb Abdul Ghafoor - The President's Office|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/PO/FormerVP/2|access-date=8 October 2020|website=presidency.gov.mv}} ==Early life and education== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. He attended the [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. == Career == Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008, he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected as President of the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) in 2011. On 12 February 2012 Ahmed Adeeb was sworn in as the Minister of Tourim and continued to serve until 22 July 2015 when he was appointed as the fifth Vice President of Maldives. On 24 October 2015, it was announced that Adeeb had been arrested by Maldives police in connection with a 28 September 2015 bomb attack which targeted President [[Abdulla Yameen]]. President Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom | publisher=Ministry of Tourism, Republic of Maldives | date=17 November 2013 | accessdate=8 January 2019}} Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Adeeb was also the chair of the Economic Council. Following the historic decision by the Maldives’ People's Majlis to bring first amendment to the 2007 Constitution by capping the eligibility age for presidency between 30 and 65 years{{Cite web|url=https://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/majlis-amends-constitution-sets-new-age-limits-for-presidency-100091|title=Majlis amends constitution, sets new age-limits for presidency – Minivan News – Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=4 December 2019}} and thereby paving the way for a “youth” Vice President and the impeachment of Dr. Mohamed Jameel Ahmed from his vice presidency portfolio, Adeeb was appointed as vice president on 23 July 2015. He represented club and country in youth age groups. His love for music led to his sponsorship and event sourcing of the biggest major concert gigs in the Maldives, which included international artist Akon, as well as Bollywood stars and bands.{{Cite web|date=January 7, 2015|title=Adeeb: Priyanka and Akon will join tomorrow|url=https://en.sun.mv/26978|access-date=4 December 2019|website=SunOnline International|language=en}} Adeeb's father served in the military and his mother worked as an executive at the Maldives Customs Service. Adeeb is married to Mariyam Nashwa and is the father of two children, daughter Eevie and son Izyan, from his previous marriage. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Vice Presidents of the Maldives}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Adeeb, Ahmed}} [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Culture ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Tourism ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Alumni of Staffordshire University]] [[Category:Edith Cowan University alumni]] [[Category:Progressive Party of Maldives politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian prisoners and detainees]] [[Category:People convicted of money laundering]] [[Category:People convicted of embezzlement]]

[[Edith Cowan University]] | website = {{URL|https://presidency.gov.mv/PO/FormerVP/2}} }} '''Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Ghafoor''' ({{lang-dv|އަޙްމަދު އަދީބު ޢަބްދުލްޣަފޫރު}}; born 11 April 1982) is a Maldivian politician who briefly served as [[Vice President of Maldives]] in 2015. Prior to his appointment on 22 July 2015, he served as the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{Cite web|title=Ahmed Adheeb Abdul Ghafoor - The President's Office|url=https://presidency.gov.mv/PO/FormerVP/2|access-date=8 October 2020|website=presidency.gov.mv}} ==Early life and education== Ahmed Adeeb was born and raised in [[Male' City]]. Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. He attended the [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. == Career == Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008, he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected as President of the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) in 2011. On 12 February 2012 Ahmed Adeeb was sworn in as the Minister of Tourism and continued to serve until 22 July 2015 when he was appointed as the fifth Vice President of Maldives. On 24 October 2015, it was announced that Adeeb had been arrested by Maldives police in connection with a 28 September 2015 bomb attack which targeted President [[Abdulla Yameen]]. On 5 November, Adeeb was removed from office as vice president by a [[no confidence vote]] from the [[People's Majlis]].{{cite news|title= Maldives crisis: Vice-President Ahmed Adeeb removed from power|work=BBC News |date=5 November 2015 |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-34736787|accessdate=5 November 2015}} [[File:Dhoonidhoo prison island - Male,maldives- 2013-05-06 22-55 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Dhoonidhoo prison island]] ==Political career== After the controversial resignation of President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] on 7 February 2012, President Waheed appointed Adeeb as Tourism Minister.{{Cite web |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |title=HaveeruOnline - Approval of Vice president and ministers sent to committee |access-date=10 July 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150710221430/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |archive-date=10 July 2015 |url-status=dead }} After [[Abdulla Yameen]] was sworn in as [[President of Maldives]], on 17 November 2013, Adeeb was appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{cite web | url=http://www.tourism.gov.mv/21/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ | title=Mr. Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Gafoor was appointed as Minister of Tourism by H.E. President Abdulla Yameen Abdul Gayoom | publisher=Ministry of Tourism, Republic of Maldives | date=17 November 2013 | accessdate=8 January 2019}} Apart from being the Tourism Minister, Adeeb was also the chair of the Economic Council. Following the historic decision by the Maldives’ People's Majlis to bring first amendment to the 2007 Constitution by capping the eligibility age for presidency between 30 and 65 years{{Cite web|url=https://minivannewsarchive.com/politics/majlis-amends-constitution-sets-new-age-limits-for-presidency-100091|title=Majlis amends constitution, sets new age-limits for presidency – Minivan News – Archive|website=minivannewsarchive.com|access-date=4 December 2019}} and thereby paving the way for a “youth” Vice President and the impeachment of Dr. Mohamed Jameel Ahmed from his vice presidency portfolio, Adeeb was appointed as vice president on 23 July 2015. Indian officials stated that Adeeb was detained because he did not have valid travel documents and did not arrive at a legal port of entry. Adeeb was transferred to the Maldives escorted by the [[Indian Coast Guard]], where he was arrested by Maldivian police.{{cite web|title=Maldives police arrest ex-vice president Adeeb after India denies entry - Times of India|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/south-asia/maldives-police-arrest-ex-vice-president-adeeb-after-india-denies-entry/articleshow/70514649.cms|accessdate=3 August 2019|website=The Times of India}} On 6 October 2020, Adeeb was sentenced to 20 years in prison, after he pleaded guilty to [[money laundering]] and [[embezzlement]] from the [[Maldives Marketing and Public Relations Corporation scandal|Maldives Marketing and Public Relations Corporation]] along with its managing director, Abdulla Ziyath, who received a prison sentence of 11 years.{{cite web|title=Maldives ex-vice president gets 20 years for graft|url=https://www.france24.com/en/20201006-maldives-ex-vice-president-gets-20-years-for-graft|accessdate=6 October 2020|website=France 24|date=6 October 2020 }}{{Cite web|title=Ex-MMPRC head Ziyath sentenced to 11 years in prison|url=https://en.sun.mv/64300|access-date=2021-12-30|website=SunOnline International|language=en}} ==Personal life == {{BLP primary sources|date=October 2021}} Adeeb is an avid footballer. He represented club and country in youth age groups. His love for music led to his sponsorship and event sourcing of one of the biggest major concert gigs in the Maldives, which included international artist Akon, as well as Bollywood stars and bands.{{Cite web|date=January 7, 2015|title=Adeeb: Priyanka and Akon will join tomorrow|url=https://en.sun.mv/26978|access-date=4 December 2019|website=SunOnline International|language=en}} Adeeb's father, Abdul Ghafoor, served in the military and his mother worked as an executive at the Maldives Customs Service. Adeeb is married to Mariyam Nashwa and is the father of two children from his previous, daughter Eevie and his 14 year old son Mommed Izyan Adeeb, from his previous marriage. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Vice Presidents of the Maldives}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Adeeb, Ahmed}} [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives]] [[Category:Culture ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Tourism ministers of the Maldives]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Alumni of Staffordshire University]] [[Category:Edith Cowan University alumni]] [[Category:Progressive Party of Maldives politicians]] [[Category:Maldivian prisoners and detainees]] [[Category:People convicted of money laundering]] [[Category:People convicted of embezzlement]]

Adeeb is the son of Abdul Ghafoor Adam and Shaheema Mohamed. He attended the [[Majeediyya School]] for his primary education before receiving his degree from [[Staffordshire University]] in 2007. He received his Master of Business Administration Degree from [[Edith Cowan University]] in 2008. == Career == Adeeb began his career in 2001 at Maldives Customs Services. After graduating in 2008, he started work as the Chief Operating Officer at Millennium Capital Holdings Pvt Ltd, before he got elected as the Treasurer of Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) the same year. He was later elected as President of the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industries (MNCCI) in 2011. On 12 February 2012 Ahmed Adeeb was sworn in as the Minister of Tourism and continued to serve until 22 July 2015 when he was appointed as the fifth Vice President of Maldives. On 24 October 2015, it was announced that Adeeb had been arrested by Maldives police in connection with a 28 September 2015 bomb attack which targeted President [[Abdulla Yameen]]. On 5 November, Adeeb was removed from office as vice president by a [[no confidence vote]] from the [[People's Majlis]].{{cite news|title= Maldives crisis: Vice-President Ahmed Adeeb removed from power|work=BBC News |date=5 November 2015 |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-34736787|accessdate=5 November 2015}} [[File:Dhoonidhoo prison island - Male,maldives- 2013-05-06 22-55 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Dhoonidhoo prison island]] ==Political career== After the controversial resignation of President [[Mohamed Nasheed]] on 7 February 2012, President Waheed appointed Adeeb as Tourism Minister.{{Cite news |last=Saeed |first=Ahmed Abdullah |date=2 April 2012 |title=Approval of Vice president and ministers sent to committee |work=[[Haveeru Daily]] |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |url-status=dead |access-date=10 July 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150710221430/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/presidnet_waheed/41204 |archive-date=10 July 2015}} After [[Abdulla Yameen]] was sworn in as [[President of Maldives]], on 17 November 2013, Adeeb was appointed as Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture.{{cite web | url=http://www.tourism.gov.mv/21/reference-is-made-to-the-ministrys-announcement-with-reference-no-iul-88-ls88201329-dated-16th-july-2013/ | title=Mr. Ahmed Adeeb Abdul Gafoor was appointed as Minister of Tourism by H.E.
